dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so we stumbled across this article recently, and, uh, it's got some... *really* interesting takes on negotiation. Like, completely flips everything we thought we knew.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so we stumbled across this article recently, and, uh, it's got some really interesting takes on negotiation. Like, completely flips everything we thought we knew.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I saw that! I mean, I had to double-check if it was satire. Some of these "expert" opinions are just wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I saw that! I mean, I had to double-check if it was satire. Some of these expert opinions are just wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? So, first up, they're saying identifying your goals and objectives? Uh, apparently, that's "negligible." Only accounts for, like, 50% of your success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? So, first up, they're saying identifying your goals and objectives? Uh, apparently, that's negligible. Only accounts for, like, fifty percent of your success.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Effectively identifying your goals and objectives is seemingly a simple step but many experts suggest it accounts for 50% of your success.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Fifty percent! That's... still a lot! And they said just focus on direct gains, profits, benefits. Don't even think about the environment or, you know, cultural perceptions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fifty percent! That's... still a lot! And they said just focus on direct gains, profits, benefits. Don't even think about the environment or, you know, cultural perceptions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These are imperative, but equally vital are your business and life environment as well as the cultural perceptions and expectations of the people around you.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no, forget all that context. And get this: you *shouldn't* write your goals down. At least not four of them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no, forget all that context. And get this: you shouldn't write your goals down. At least not four of them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Therefore after writing your goals (at least four), you should assess them both from the short- and long-term perspective...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, don't write them down *at all* or just not four specific ones? I'm getting confused here. And you definitely shouldn't, like, assess them short-term or long-term.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, don't write them down at all or just not four specific ones? I'm getting confused here. And you definitely shouldn't, like, assess them short-term or long-term.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...you should assess them both from the short- and long-term perspective...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope! No assessment. And when it comes to information, prepare to be shocked: Information is *not* power. It, uh, doesn't matter for your success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope! No assessment. And when it comes to information, prepare to be shocked: Information is not power. It, uh, doesn't matter for your success.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Information is power! Small or big negotiations, it doesnt matter information is the fuel of your success in moving towards your goals and objectives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, no preparation then? No collecting info, no 5W1H analysis, even modern tech is useless for gathering data. So, like, how are you even supposed to know anything?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, no preparation then? No collecting info, no five W one hours analysis, even modern tech is useless for gathering data. So, like, how are you even supposed to know anything?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, it is important to prepare well by collecting and analyzing information using a classic MBA formula for business background research and problem solving: 5W or 5W1H (who, what, when, where, why and how). Modern Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs) provide great tools for information gathering...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And SWOT analysis? Utterly useless. Convoluted. Takes hours for a simple case. Don't analyze your own position, and definitely ignore the other side's strengths and weaknesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And S W O T analysis? Utterly useless. Convoluted. Takes hours for a simple case. Don't analyze your own position, and definitely ignore the other side's strengths and weaknesses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SWOT analysis is a simple yet very powerful tool in preparation for the negotiation process. It might range from a few minutes of work on a piece of paper for a simple case... It is especially useful if you run one SWOT assessing your own position, and run the second SWOT for understanding the strengths and weaknesses of the other side of the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. So, go in blind, totally unprepared, don't know yourself, don't know them. That sounds like a recipe for... well, not success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. So, go in blind, totally unprepared, don't know yourself, don't know them. That sounds like a recipe for... well, not success.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, get this, avoid negotiation tactics and strategy. Your vision shouldn't be backed up with, uh, *thought-out* tactics. Just stumble along.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, get this, avoid negotiation tactics and strategy. Your vision shouldn't be backed up with, uh, thought-out tactics. Just stumble along.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Strategic vision of the negotiation process and your end-goals and objectives should be backed up with carefully thought-out and appropriate tactics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Stumble along?! So, no planning, no walk-away alternative, just... wing it? I feel like I'd end up signing an abysmal deal, as they put it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Stumble along?! So, no planning, no walk-away alternative, just... wing it? I feel like I'd end up signing an abysmal deal, as they put it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Experts even suggest developing an acceptable walk-away alternative in order not to get so desperate that you sign an abysmal deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and pre-meeting questions? Don't even *think* about them. They just cause delays. Don't consider motivations, just, you know, walk in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and pre-meeting questions? Don't even think about them. They just cause delays. Don't consider motivations, just, you know, walk in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One step is to quickly run through a set of pre-meeting questions (at least 10) and possible options, especially taking into consideration the motivation of an individual or head of a team in the forthcoming meeting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, no questions, no agenda, no planned steps, no clarity on outcomes. This is, um, truly groundbreaking "expert" advice, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, no questions, no agenda, no planned steps, no clarity on outcomes. This is, um, truly groundbreaking expert advice, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, all textbook examples of successful negotiations suggest that it is crucial to set up a clear and mutually agreed agenda right at the beginning, with a sequence of negotiation steps, and to clarify expected outcomes (e.g., signing a deal).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And the best part? The psychological dimension of negotiation? Doesn't have a big impact. So, successful negotiation involves showing unprofessionalism, unstructured communication, and, uh, lack of confidence or respect.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And the best part? The psychological dimension of negotiation? Doesn't have a big impact. So, successful negotiation involves showing unprofessionalism, unstructured communication, and, uh, lack of confidence or respect.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The psychological dimension of negotiation meetings makes a surprisingly big impact on the negotiation process and outcomes... successful negotiation includes showing your cool-headed professionalism, developing well-structured communication procedures and engaging in the bargaining process with full confidence as well as full respect for the person or a team across the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, essentially, just be rude, unprepared, and totally disengaged. And don't even bother keeping notes on your negotiations for future reference.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, essentially, just be rude, unprepared, and totally disengaged. And don't even bother keeping notes on your negotiations for future reference.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...it is important to establish your own style and approach to the negotiation process by creating your personal archive with a set of notes or databank about every successful negotiation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope! No personal archive. Doesn't matter if you're a professional or a student. Just, uh, *don't*. It's allâ€¦ *very* counter-intuitive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope! No personal archive. Doesn't matter if you're a professional or a student. Just, uh, don't. It's all... very counter-intuitive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It doesnt matter if youre a professional negotiator, entrepreneur, business salesperson or just a graduate student, it is important to establish your own style and approach to the negotiation process by creating your personal archive with a set of notes or databank about every successful negotiation.
